alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 10:53AM EDT until September 30 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Berkeley. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 AM EDT, Doppler radar detected widespread moderate rain across Berkeley County, with embedded areas of heavy rain. The area of rain is expected to persist through the afternoon hours as Hurricane Ian makes landfall and tracks inland later today. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Roadway flooding maybe an issue for many areas, especially across Moncks Corner. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen so far today. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moncks Corner, Saint Stephen, Bonneau, Jamestown, Old Santee Canal State Park, Bonneau Beach, Pinopolis, Southern Lake Moultrie, Northern Lake Moultrie, Cross, Huger, Eadytown, Eastern Lake Marion, Simpson Crossing, Macbeth, Stony Landing, Wadboo, Wampee, Old Cordesville and Sugar Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
